articles.author: Alvise Armellini
articles.description: The largest and most geographically diverse conclave in history was due to resume on Thursday, with Roman Catholic cardinals returning to the Sistine Chapel to try to settle a wide-open papal election.
articles.title: Cardinals set for second day of conclave to elect a new pope

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A blast was heard in Pakistan's eastern city of Lahore on Thursday morning, according to broadcaster Geo TV and a Reuters witness, a day after Indian strikes at multiple locations in the country and fears of an escalation in conflict between the nuclear-armed neighbours.
articles.title: Blast heard in Pakistan's Lahore amid tensions with India, Reuters witness says

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: Bill Gates pledged on Thursday to give away almost his entire personal wealth in the next two decades and said the world's poorest would receive some $200 billion via his foundation at a time when governments worldwide are slashing international aid.
articles.title: Bill Gates to give away fortune by 2045, $200 billion for world's poorest

articles.author: Alistair Smout, Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: The United States and Britain are expected to announce a deal to lower tariffs on some goods, the first such agreement since U.S. President Donald Trump imposed levies on countries around the world.
articles.title: US and Britain expected to announce tariff deal on Thursday

articles.author: Dmitry Antonov
articles.description: Vladimir Putin welcomed Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday for talks in the Kremlin that Moscow hopes will provide a diplomatic boost for the Russian leader at a key moment in the war with Ukraine.
articles.title: Putin greets China's Xi at Kremlin

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mahmoud Issa
articles.description: Dozens of community kitchens in Gaza shut their doors on Thursday due to a lack of supplies, closing off a lifeline used by hundreds of thousands of people in a further blow to efforts to combat growing hunger in the enclave.
articles.title: Dozens of Gaza communal kitchens shut as supply runs out, worsening hunger

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Ukraine's parliament voted on Thursday in favour of ratifying a minerals deal signed with the United States, an agreement Kyiv hopes will secure future military assistance from Washington in its fight to repel Russian troops.
articles.title: Ukraine's parliament ratifies minerals deal with US, hopes for more arms

articles.author: Christian Lowe
articles.description: A three-day ceasefire declared by Russia came into effect on Thursday morning with skies over Ukraine's major cities quiet, in a change from successive nights of heavy attacks by Russian drones and ballistic missiles.
articles.title: Ukraine's cities quiet as Kremlin-sponsored ceasefire kicks in

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: "Peace be with all you," Pope Leo XIV said from the balcony of St. Peter's Basilica on Thursday, in his first public words.
articles.title: 'Peace be with all you,' Pope Leo XIV says in first public words

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Ismail Shakil
articles.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio urged de-escalation and expressed support for direct dialogue in separate calls with Indian External Affairs Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar and Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Thursday, U.S. State Department spokesperson Tammy Bruce said.
articles.title: Rubio urges India and Pakistan to de-escalate, backs direct dialogue
